page.title: 09FARMING IN THURSTON
page.content:
A MIXED FARM IN THURSTON
We went to Manor Farm.First we saw a 10 month old bull,then we saw a herd of Friesian cows and one bull.The cows are fed on straw in winter and grass in summer and spring. We saw machines such as a sprayer,and a straw-cutter,and a plough with ten blades. We saw where the cattle are milked;they sometimes have oats while when they are milked.First,the udders are cleaned with a hosepipe,then the suction cups are put on. In the morning the farmworkers get up between 5:30 and 7:30 and work until 6:30 or 8:30pm. We saw some chickens,quail,and red and black turkeys.The farm grows peas, oilseed rape,and cereals on 400 acres.
